Package com.example.ss7g7.stars

Class StarsSystem

java.lang.Object
com.example.ss7g7.stars.StarsSystem
public class StarsSystem
extends java.lang.Object

Stars System

The Stars System is the base framework that is used for authentication and decides which menu to show depending on the user who logged in.

The StarsSystem class initializes the database, StarsDB It runs the login and keeps track of the current user.

Since:
2020/10/15
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ong Rui Peng, Angelina

  • Constructor Details

    • StarsSystem

      public StarsSystem()
      Constructor of StarsSystem. Gets instance of StarsDB.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public boolean init()
      Initializes the stars system. Calls the StarsDB singleton and passes the relative string file paths to the data files to the database to initialize.
      Returns:
      true if database successfully initialized;

    • run

      public void run()
      Main loop of the system that will run as long as user exists the Stars System. Starts by asking user for login and running respective menus(UI) depending on the user which logged in.
